title: ServiceNow gets a lot more specific with its workflows
description: Platform update includes environmental, social, and governance (ESG) management -- a topic that is fast gaining corporate traction.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: AI language models as-a-service "potentially one of the largest software opportunities ever"
description: Huang said both AI and Omniverse will be "very long-term SaaS platforms" for Nvidia.

title: Applications for Samsung's $2 million STEM education contest open today
description: Through its Solve for Tomorrow initiative, Samsung will award a total of $2 million in technology and supplies to classrooms in every state.

title: How to limit Spotlight search to improve privacy in MacOS
description: Here's how you can exclude specific directories from showing up in MacOS Spotlight for increased privacy.

title: The 5 best travel steamers of 2022
description: Luggage can crease your clothing, especially if you travel often. Dissolve winkles fast with the best travel steamers, so you'll look sleek and confident everywhere you go.

title: Logitech aims adjustable key light and premium mic at streamers, podcasters
description: The company's Logitech for Creators line is expanding with a compact new key light for streamers and a high-end, dynamic XLR microphone designed for video and podcast producers.

title: How to create different network locations in MacOS for more flexible connections
description: Jack Wallen shows you how to use a MacOS feature that helps make connecting to different networks easier and more purpose-driven.

title: How to configure Android to handle incoming spam calls
description: If you find yourself always inundated with spam calls on your Android phone, Jack Wallen might just have the cure for that issue.

title: The 4 iOS 16 settings you need to turn off now to save your data
description: This will help to stop you burning through your cellular data plan in a matter of days.

title: Microsoft's October 12 Surface launch: What's on tap
description: Microsoft's expected Fall Surface launch event now has an official date but not a lot of other hints. Expectations are there could be a couple of Arm-based devices unveiled.

title: Framework's new Chromebook laptop pieces together the best of both worlds
description: Just when you thought Chromebooks had maxed out on long-term value.

title: StarlingX, the cloud for edge computing, gets a major upgrade
description: If you want a complete cloud stack for your edge computing -- whether you're running a handful of IoT devices or thousands of 5G endpoints -- StarlingX 7.0 is for you.

title: Amazon refreshes Kindle Fire HD 8 lineup ahead of big devices event next week
description: The new Kindle Fire HD 8 tablets have something for everyone, including young and older kids.

title: Garmin Index BPM announced: Blood pressure monitoring finally arrives in Garmin Connect
description: There is a host of health and wellness data contained in the Garmin Connect service, but one of the key pieces missing has been blood pressure tracking. Garmin launched a new smart blood pressure monitor so now integrates BP into its ecosystem.

title: The future of the web could be bright. But there's a lot to fix first
description: As a new era of the internet approaches, we risk carrying over today's unresolved problems too.

title: Digital transformation: 5 ways to make the most of all that data you have
description: Companies continue to collect ever-increasing amounts of data. Smart professionals will find ways to turn information into a competitive advantage.

title: Open-source software that lasts a thousand years? GitHub adds to its frozen Arctic Code Vault
description: GitHub's Arctic Code Vault with terabytes of code would have been "doomed" if it wasn't stored in a beautiful case.

title: What can you expect on Tesla AI Day?
description: Tesla AI Day is sure to feature news about electric vehicles, but with Tesla, there are always surprises.

title: Singapore workers feel disconnected in hybrid workplace
description: Hybrid work practices may offer more flexibility, but 54% of Singapore workers say there are fewer opportunities to build rapport via remote meetings and 56% cite connectivity issues as a top challenge.
